} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Server Time Zone and Locale DESCRIPTION: Commands to reconfigure the server's time zone and check/install locales. This ensures the server's time settings match the DHIS2 deployment location. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/installation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo dpkg-reconfigure tzdata locale -a sudo locale-gen nb_NO.UTF-8 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Validating Payload Example DESCRIPTION: Example of validating a data element payload using curl, showing how to send a POST request to the schemas endpoint. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/metadata.md#2025-04-22_snippet_27 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -X POST -d "{\"name\": \"some name\"}" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -u admin:district "https://play.dhis2.org/dev/api/schemas/dataElement" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Data Set Metadata Export with Dependencies DESCRIPTION: Endpoint for exporting a data set with all its dependencies, which can be imported to another DHIS2 instance. The export is in JSON format and includes all related metadata. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/metadata.md#2025-04-22_snippet_32 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` /api/dataSets/{id}/metadata.json ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: DHIS2 Complete Configuration Reference (dhis.conf) DESCRIPTION: Comprehensive reference for the dhis.conf configuration file that controls DHIS2 system behavior. The file includes mandatory and optional settings for database connections, connection pooling, server configuration, system settings, encryption, file storage, LDAP integration, node identification, monitoring, Redis integration, and analytics database configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/installation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_50 LANGUAGE: properties CODE: ``` # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # Database connection for PostgreSQL [Mandatory] # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # Hibernate SQL dialect connection.dialect = org.hibernate.dialect.PostgreSQLDialect # JDBC driver class connection.driver_class = org.postgresql.Driver # Database connection URL connection.url = jdbc:postgresql:dhis2 # Database username connection.username = dhis # Database password (sensitive) connection.password = xxxx # Max size of connection pool (default: 40) connection.pool.max_size = 40 # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # Database connection pool [Optional] # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # Minimum number of Connections a pool will maintain at any given time (default: 5). connection.pool.min_size = 5 # Number of connections a pool will try to acquire upon startup. Should be between minPoolSize and maxPoolSize. connection.pool.initial_size = 5 # Determines how many connections at a time will try to acquire when the pool is exhausted. connection.pool.acquire_incr = 5 # Seconds a Connection can remain pooled but unused before being discarded. Zero means idle connections never expire. (default: 7200) connection.pool.max_idle_time = 7200 # Number of seconds that connections in excess of minPoolSize is permitted to remain idle in the pool before being culled (default: 0) connection.pool.max_idle_time_excess_con = 0 # If greater than 0, dhis2 will test all idle, pooled but unchecked-out connections, every this number of seconds. (default: 0) connection.pool.idle.con.test.period = 0 # If on, an operation will be performed at every connection checkout to verify that the connection is valid. (default: false) connection.pool.test.on.checkout = false # If on, an operation will be performed asynchronously at every connection checkin to verify that the connection is valid. (default: on) connection.pool.test.on.checkin = on # Determines the query that will be executed for all connection tests connection.pool.preferred.test.query = select 1 # Determines the number of helper threads used by dhis2 for jdbc operations. (default: 3) connection.pool.num.helper.threads = 3 # Database connection pool type, supported types are 'c3p0' (default), 'hikari', 'unpooled' db.pool.type = c3p0 # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # Server [Mandatory] # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # Base URL to the DHIS 2 instance server.base.url = https://play.dhis2.org/dev # Enable secure settings if system is deployed on HTTPS, can be 'off', 'on' server.https = off # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # System [Optional] # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # System mode for database read operations only, can be 'off', 'on' system.read_only_mode = off # Session timeout in seconds, default is 3600 system.session.timeout = 3600 # SQL view protected tables, can be 'on', 'off' system.sql_view_table_protection = on # SQL view write enabled, can be 'on', 'off' system.sql_view_write_enabled = off # Disable server-side program rule execution, can be 'on', 'off' system.program_rule.server_execution = on # Remote servers which the server is allowed to call, hostnames should end with '/', default is empty metadata.sync.remote_servers_allowed = https://server1.org/,https://server2.org/ # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # Encryption [Optional] # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # Encryption password (sensitive) encryption.password = xxxx # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # File store [Optional] # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # File store provider. Currently 'filesystem' (default), 'aws-s3' and 's3' are supported. filestore.provider = filesystem # Directory / bucket name, folder below DHIS2_HOME on file system, 'bucket' in AWS S3 filestore.container = files # URL where the S3 compatible API can be accessed (only for provider 's3') filestore.endpoint = http://minio:9000 # Datacenter location (not required) filestore.location = eu-west-1 # Public identity / username filestore.identity = dhis2-id # Secret key / password (sensitive) filestore.secret = xxxx # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # LDAP [Optional] # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # LDAP server URL ldap.url = ldaps://300.20.300.20:636 # LDAP manager user distinguished name ldap.manager.dn = cn=JohnDoe,ou=Country,ou=Admin,dc=hisp,dc=org # LDAP manager user password (sensitive) ldap.manager.password = xxxx # LDAP entry distinguished name search base ldap.search.base = dc=hisp,dc=org # LDAP entry distinguished name filter ldap.search.filter = (cn={0}) # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # Node [Optional] # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # Node identifier, optional, useful in clusters node.id = 'node-1' # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # Monitoring [Optional] # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # DHIS2 API monitoring monitoring.api.enabled = on # JVM monitoring monitoring.jvm.enabled = on # Database connection pool monitoring monitoring.dbpool.enabled = on # Hibernate monitoring, do not use in production monitoring.hibernate.enabled = off # Uptime monitoring monitoring.uptime.enabled = on # CPU monitoring monitoring.cpu.enabled = on # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # Redis [Optional] # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # Redis enabled redis.enabled = true # Redis host name redis.host = localhost # Redis port redis.port = 6379 # Redis password redis.password = xxxx # Use SSL for connections to Redis, can be 'on', 'off' (default) redis.use.ssl = off # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # Analytics database [Optional] # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # Analytics database JDBC driver class analytics.connection.driver_class = org.postgresql.Driver # Analytics database connection URL analytics.connection.url = jdbc:postgresql:analytics # Analytics database username analytics.connection.username = analytics # Analytics database password analytics.connection.password = xxxx # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # Analytics database [Optional] # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # Analytics unlogged tables. Can be 'on' (default), 'off'. analytics.table.unlogged = on # Dimensions to skip indexes for analytics tables # analytics.table.skip_index = EC40NXmsTVu,gtuVl6NbXQV,LFsZ8v5v7rq,\ yY2bQYqNt0o,eLwL77Z9E7R,WnouSiGrbgy,\ veGzholzPQm,qzsxBXFf5yb,SooXFOUnciJ # Period type columns to skip for analytics tables # analytics.table.skip_column = weeklywednesday,weeklythursday,weeklysaturday,\ weeklysunday,biweekly,quarterlynov,\ sixmonthlyapril,financialapril,financialjuly # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # System telemetry [Optional] # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # System monitoring URL system.monitoring.url = # System monitoring username system.monitoring.username = dhis # System monitoring password (sensitive) system.monitoring.password = xxxx ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Exposing DHIS2 Resources Publicly via NGINX with Basic Authentication DESCRIPTION: NGINX configuration to make specific DHIS2 resources publicly available through a separate domain using Basic Authentication. This setup allows GET requests only, removes cookies to prevent session changes, and includes a Base64-encoded Authorization header. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/installation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_48 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` http { .. server { listen 80; server_name api.somedomain.com; location ~ ^/(api/(charts|chartValues|reports|reportTables|documents|maps|organisationUnits)|dhis-web-commons/javascripts|images|dhis-web-commons-ajax-json|dhis-web-mapping|dhis-web-visualizer) { if ($request_method != GET) { return 405; } proxy_pass http://localhost:8080; proxy_redirect off; proxy_set_header Host $host; proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr; proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for; proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto http; proxy_set_header Authorization "Basic YWRtaW46ZGlzdHJpY3Q="; proxy_set_header Cookie ""; proxy_hide_header Set-Cookie; } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Multiple User Invitations JSON Payload in DHIS2 Web API DESCRIPTION: Example JSON payload for inviting multiple users at once. Contains an array of user objects under the 'users' property, each with their own information, credentials, roles, and organization units. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/users.md#2025-04-22_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "users": [ { "firstName": "John", "surname": "Doe", "email": "johndoe@mail.com", "userCredentials": { "username": "johndoe", "userRoles": [ { "id": "Euq3XfEIEbx" } ] }, "organisationUnits": [ { "id": "ImspTQPwCqd" } ] }, { "firstName": "Tom", "surname": "Johnson", "email": "tomj@mail.com", "userCredentials": { "userRoles": [ { "id": "Euq3XfEIEbx" } ] }, "organisationUnits": [ { "id": "ImspTQPwCqd" } ] } ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Sending Bulk Data Values in JSON Format DESCRIPTION: Example of sending multiple data values using JSON format. The structure allows for multiple data values with different periods and organization units. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/data.md#2025-04-22_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "dataValues": [ { "dataElement": "f7n9E0hX8qk", "period": "201401", "orgUnit": "DiszpKrYNg8", "value": "12" }, { "dataElement": "f7n9E0hX8qk", "period": "201401", "orgUnit": "FNnj3jKGS7i", "value": "14" }, { "dataElement": "f7n9E0hX8qk", "period": "201402", "orgUnit": "DiszpKrYNg8", "value": "16" }, { "dataElement": "f7n9E0hX8qk", "period": "201402", "orgUnit": "Jkhdsf8sdf4", "value": "18" } ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating an Event Working List in DHIS2 DESCRIPTION: JSON payload for creating an event working list, specifying program, event query criteria, and various filtering options such as event date, data filters, assigned users, and display column order. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/tracker.md#2025-04-22_snippet_53 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "name": "event working list", "program": "VBqh0ynB2wv", "eventQueryCriteria": { "eventDate": { "period": "LAST_WEEK", "type": "RELATIVE" }, "dataFilters": [ { "ge": "35", "le": "70", "dataItem": "qrur9Dvnyt5" } ], "assignedUserMode": "PROVIDED", "assignedUsers": [ "CotVI2NX0rI", "xE7jOejl9FI" ], "status": "ACTIVE", "order": "occurredAt:desc", "displayColumnOrder": [ "occurredAt", "status", "assignedUser", "qrur9Dvnyt5", "oZg33kd9taw" ] } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring PostgreSQL for DHIS2 in Bash DESCRIPTION: Sample configuration file content for optimizing PostgreSQL performance for DHIS2. This includes settings for connections, memory allocation, and query optimization. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/how-to/PostgreSQL-setup.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Postgresql settings for DHIS2 # Adjust depending on number of DHIS2 instances and their pool size # By default each instance requires up to 80 connections # This might be different if you have set pool in dhis.conf max_connections = 200 # Tune these according to your environment # About 25% available RAM for postgres shared_buffers = 3GB # Multiply by max_connections to know potentially how much RAM is required work_mem=20MB # As much as you can reasonably afford. Helps with index generation # during the analytics generation task maintenance_work_mem=512MB # if your database is going to be accessed over the network, you want to #allow its access by ensuring its listens on the appropriate interface, '*' #will listen to all interfaces. #listen_address "*" # Approx 80% of (Available RAM - maintenance_work_mem - max_connections*work_mem) effective_cache_size=8GB checkpoint_completion_target = 0.8 synchronous_commit = off wal_writer_delay = 10000ms random_page_cost = 1.1 log_min_duration_statement = 300s # This is required for DHIS2.32+ max_locks_per_transaction = 128 jit = off ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Add Metadata Proposal JSON Format in DHIS2 DESCRIPTION: Example JSON payload for proposing the addition of a new metadata object (organization unit) using the metadata proposal workflow API. Includes the proposal type, target object type, and the full object definition. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/metadata.md#2025-04-22_snippet_107 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "type": "ADD", "target": "ORGANISATION_UNIT", "change": {"name":"My Unit", "shortName":"MyOU", "openingDate": "2020-01-01"} } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: DHIS2 Database Configuration DESCRIPTION: Sample DHIS2 configuration file content including database connection settings and server configuration SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/installation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: properties CODE: ``` # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # Database connection # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # JDBC driver class connection.driver_class = org.postgresql.Driver # Database connection URL connection.url = jdbc:postgresql:dhis2 # Database username connection.username = dhis # Database password connection.password = xxxx # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # Server # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # Enable secure settings if deployed on HTTPS, default 'off', can be 'on' # server.https = on # Server base URL # server.base.url = https://server.com ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Metadata Import Response Example DESCRIPTION: Example of the JSON response returned by the metadata import API after successfully importing data elements and indicators. It includes import parameters used and statistics on created, updated, and ignored objects. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/metadata.md#2025-04-22_snippet_39 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "importParams": { "userOverrideMode": "NONE", "importMode": "COMMIT", "identifier": "UID", "preheatMode": "REFERENCE", "importStrategy": "CREATE_AND_UPDATE", "atomicMode": "ALL", "flushMode": "AUTO", "skipSharing": false, "skipTranslation": false, "skipValidation": false, "metadataSyncImport": false, "firstRowIsHeader": true, "username": "UNICEF_admin" }, "status": "OK", "typeReports": [ { "klass": "org.hisp.dhis.dataelement.DataElement", "stats": { "created": 2, "updated": 0, "deleted": 0, "ignored": 0, "total": 2 } }, { "klass": "org.hisp.dhis.indicator.Indicator", "stats": { "created": 1, "updated": 0, "deleted": 0, "ignored": 0, "total": 1 } } ], "stats": { "created": 3, "updated": 0, "deleted": 0, "ignored": 0, "total": 3 } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Paginated Query for Recent Events in DHIS2 API DESCRIPTION: Example request to fetch the 10 most recent events for a specific program and organization unit, using pagination and sorting. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/tracker.md#2025-04-22_snippet_38 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` GET /api/tracker/events?orgUnit=DiszpKrYNg8&program=eBAyeGv0exc&order=occurredAt:desc&pageSize=10&page=1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Requesting XML Format Analytics Data in DHIS2 API DESCRIPTION: This API call shows how to request analytics data in XML format. It includes dimensions for data, period, and organization units. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/analytics.md#2025-04-22_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` /api/analytics.xml?dimension=dx:fbfJHSPpUQD&dimension=pe:2016&dimension=ou:O6uvpzGd5pu;lc3eMKXaEfw ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Additional PostgreSQL Extensions for DHIS2 DESCRIPTION: Commands to install btree_gin and pg_trgm extensions for DHIS2 version 2.38 and later. These are required for trigram indexes and compound indexing. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/installation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo -u postgres psql -c "create extension btree_gin;" dhis2 sudo -u postgres psql -c "create extension pg_trgm;" dhis2 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Azure AD OIDC Provider in DHIS2 properties file DESCRIPTION: Example dhis.conf configuration for enabling OIDC login with Azure AD as the identity provider. Includes settings for tenant ID, client ID, client secret, redirect URL, logout redirect URL, and optional mapping claim. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/reference/oauth.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: properties CODE: ``` # Enables OIDC login oidc.oauth2.login.enabled = on # First provider (azure.0): # Tenant ID, also called Directory ID, in UUID format oidc.provider.azure.0.tenant = # Client id, given to you in the Azure portal, in UUID format oidc.provider.azure.0.client_id = # Client secret, given to you in the Azure portal oidc.provider.azure.0.client_secret = # [Optional] Authorized redirect URI, the as set in Azure portal # If your public hostname is different from what the server sees internally, # you need to provide your full public URL oidc.provider.azure.0.redirect_url = https://mydhis2-server.org/oauth2/code/azure.0 # [Optional] Where to redirect after logging out. # If your public hostname is different from what the server sees internally, # you need to provide your full public URL oidc.logout.redirect_url = https://mydhis2-server.org # [Optional], defaults to 'email' oidc.provider.azure.0.mapping_claim = email # [Optional], defaults to 'on' oidc.provider.azure.0.support_logout = on # Second provider (azure.1): # Tenant ID, also called Directory ID, in UUID format oidc.provider.azure.1.tenant = ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Data Store Entry - BASH/JSON DESCRIPTION: Example of creating a new key-value pair in the DHIS2 data store using curl with JSON payload. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/data-store.md#2025-04-22_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl "https://play.dhis2.org/demo/api/33/dataStore/foo/key_1" -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d "{\"foo\":\"bar\"}" -u admin:district ``` LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "httpStatus": "OK", "httpStatusCode": 201, "status": "OK", "message": "Key 'key_1' created." } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring HTTPS with Nginx for DHIS2 DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the Nginx configuration for setting up HTTPS for a DHIS2 server. It includes SSL certificate paths, security headers, and proxy settings to forward requests to the DHIS2 application. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/how-to/secure-dhis2.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: nginx CODE: ``` server { listen 443 ssl; server_name example.com; ssl_certificate /etc/letsencrypt/live/example.com/fullchain.pem; ssl_certificate_key /etc/letsencrypt/live/example.com/privkey.pem; ssl_protocols TLSv1.2 TLSv1.3; ssl_ciphers HIGH:!aNULL:!MD5; add_header Strict-Transport-Security "max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains" always; add_header X-Frame-Options "SAMEORIGIN"; add_header X-Content-Type-Options nosniff; add_header X-XSS-Protection "1; mode=block"; location / { proxy_pass http://localhost:8080; proxy_set_header Host $host; proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr; proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for; proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto $scheme; } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Restarting PostgreSQL Service DESCRIPTION: Command to restart the PostgreSQL service after applying configuration changes. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/concepts/PostgreSQL-performance-tuning.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo systemctl restart postgresql ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Documents in DHIS2 API DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to create a new document resource in DHIS2 using a POST request with JSON payload. The document references an external URL. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/metadata.md#2025-04-22_snippet_82 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -X POST -d @document.json -H "Content-type: application/json" "http://dhis.domain/api/documents" ``` LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "name": "dhis home", "external": true, "url": "https://www.dhis2.org" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Nginx Load Balancer for DHIS2 Cluster DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows an Nginx configuration for load balancing DHIS2 cluster instances, including upstream server definitions and proxy pass settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/installation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_33 LANGUAGE: nginx CODE: ``` http { # Upstream element with sticky sessions upstream dhis_cluster { ip_hash; server 193.157.199.131:8080; server 193.157.199.132:8080; } # Proxy pass to backend servers in cluster server { listen 80; location / { proxy_pass http://dhis_cluster/; } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: GET Single Enrollment Response Format in JSON DESCRIPTION: Sample JSON response from the /api/tracker/enrollments/{uid} endpoint showing the format of a single enrollment object. The response includes all enrollment metadata and status information for a specific enrollment. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/tracker.md#2025-04-22_snippet_33 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "enrollment": "JMgRZyeLWOo", "createdAt": "2017-03-06T05:49:28.340", "createdAtClient": "2016-03-06T05:49:28.340", "updatedAt": "2017-03-06T05:49:28.357", "trackedEntity": "PQfMcpmXeFE", "program": "IpHINAT79UW", "status": "ACTIVE", "orgUnit": "DiszpKrYNg8", "enrolledAt": "2024-03-06T00:00:00.000", "occurredAt": "2024-03-04T00:00:00.000", "followUp": false, "deleted": false, "notes": [] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: DHIS2 Database Connection Configuration DESCRIPTION: Properties file content for configuring DHIS2 connection to PostgreSQL, including driver class, connection URL, username, and password. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/getting-started/linux-manual-install.md#2025-04-22_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: properties CODE: ``` # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # Database connection # ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # JDBC driver class connection.driver_class = org.postgresql.Driver # Database connection URL connection.url = jdbc:postgresql:dhis # Database username connection.username = dhis # Database password connection.password = xxxx ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Events JSON Response in DHIS2 Tracker API DESCRIPTION: Example JSON response when retrieving events from the DHIS2 Tracker API. It includes event details, data values, and geometry information. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/tracker.md#2025-04-22_snippet_43 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "pager": { "page": 1, "pageSize": 1 }, "events": [ { "event": "A7rzcnZTe2T", "status": "ACTIVE", "program": "eBAyeGv0exc", "programStage": "Zj7UnCAulEk", "enrollment": "RiLEKhWHlxZ", "orgUnit": "DwpbWkiqjMy", "occurredAt": "2023-02-13T00:00:00.000", "scheduledAt": "2023-02-13T00:00:00.000", "followUp": false, "deleted": false, "createdAt": "2017-09-08T21:40:22.000", "createdAtClient": "2016-09-08T21:40:22.000", "updatedAt": "2017-09-08T21:40:22.000", "attributeOptionCombo": "HllvX50cXC0", "attributeCategoryOptions": "xYerKDKCefk", "geometry": { "type": "Point", "coordinates": [ -11.468912037323042, 7.515913998868316 ] }, "dataValues": [ { "createdAt": "2016-12-06T18:22:34.438", "updatedAt": "2016-12-06T18:22:34.438", "storedBy": "bjorn", "providedElsewhere": false, "dataElement": "F3ogKBuviRA", "value": "[-11.4880220438585,7.50978830548003]" }, { "createdAt": "2013-12-30T14:23:57.423", "updatedAt": "2013-12-30T14:23:57.423", "storedBy": "lars", "providedElsewhere": false, "dataElement": "eMyVanycQSC", "value": "2018-02-07" }, { "createdAt": "2013-12-30T14:23:57.382", "updatedAt": "2013-12-30T14:23:57.382", "storedBy": "lars", "providedElsewhere": false, "dataElement": "oZg33kd9taw", "value": "Male" } ], "notes": [], "followup": false } ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Event Status in DHIS2 Program Rules DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to check the status of an event using the V{event_status} variable in a DHIS2 program rule expression. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/user/configure-programs-in-the-maintenance-app.md#2025-04-22_snippet_65 LANGUAGE: dhis2 CODE: ``` V{event_status} == 'COMPLETED' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Program Metadata Export with Dependencies DESCRIPTION: Endpoint for exporting a program with all its dependencies, which can be imported to another DHIS2 instance. The export is in JSON format and includes all related metadata. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/metadata.md#2025-04-22_snippet_33 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` /api/programs/{id}/metadata.json ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Aggregate Event Analytics in DHIS2 DESCRIPTION: Example of querying the /analytics/events/aggregate endpoint for retrieving aggregated numbers of events. This query filters events by program, date range, organisation units, and specific data elements with filters. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/analytics.md#2025-04-22_snippet_30 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` /api/analytics/events/aggregate/eBAyeGv0exc?startDate=2016-01-01&endDate=2016-10-31 &dimension=ou:O6uvpzGd5pu&dimension=oZg33kd9taw:EQ:Female&dimension=qrur9Dvnyt5:GT:50 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Modifying Tomcat Startup Script for DHIS2 DESCRIPTION: Modify the Tomcat startup script to prevent running as root and set the correct Catalina base. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/getting-started/linux-manual-install.md#2025-04-22_snippet_20 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` #!/bin/sh set -e if [ "$(id -u)" -eq "0" ]; then echo "This script must NOT be run as root" 1>&2 exit 1 fi export CATALINA_BASE="/home/dhis/tomcat-dhis" /usr/share/tomcat9/bin/startup.sh echo "Tomcat started" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deleting Objects Using DHIS2 API DESCRIPTION: Shows how to delete objects using a DELETE HTTP request with basic authentication. Requires the object ID and endpoint type. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/metadata.md#2025-04-22_snippet_24 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -X DELETE -u user:password "http://server/api/constants/ID" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Program Notification Template in DHIS2 API DESCRIPTION: JSON payload for creating a new program notification template. Configures triggers, templates, recipients, and delivery channels for notifications that can be sent based on program events or rules. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/tracker.md#2025-04-22_snippet_57 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "name": "Case notification", "notificationTrigger": "ENROLLMENT", "subjectTemplate": "Case notification V{org_unit_name}", "displaySubjectTemplate": "Case notification V{org_unit_name}", "notifyUsersInHierarchyOnly": false, "sendRepeatable": false, "notificationRecipient": "ORGANISATION_UNIT_CONTACT", "notifyParentOrganisationUnitOnly": false, "displayMessageTemplate": "Case notification A{h5FuguPFF2j}", "messageTemplate": "Case notification A{h5FuguPFF2j}", "deliveryChannels": [ "EMAIL" ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Sending Outbound Email via cURL DESCRIPTION: cURL command to send a general email notification with specified recipients, message, and subject. Requires F_SEND_EMAIL or ALL authority and URL-encoded parameters. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/email.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl "localhost/api/33/email/notification?recipients=xyz%40abc.com&message=sample%20email&subject=Test%20Email" -X POST -u admin:district ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Merging Data Elements via POST Request in DHIS2 API DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the structure of a POST request to merge data elements in DHIS2. It specifies the source data elements, target data element, deletion preference, and data merge strategy. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/metadata.md#2025-04-22_snippet_54 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "sources": [ "jNb63DIHuwU", "WAjjFMDJKcx" ], "target": "V9rfpjwHbYg", "deleteSources": true, "dataMergeStrategy": "DISCARD" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing PostgreSQL Extensions for DHIS2 DESCRIPTION: Commands to install required PostgreSQL extensions (PostGIS, btree_gin, pg_trgm) for DHIS2 GIS features and performance optimization. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/getting-started/linux-manual-install.md#2025-04-22_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` sudo -u postgres psql -c "create extension postgis;" dhis sudo -u postgres psql -c "create extension btree_gin;" dhis sudo -u postgres psql -c "create extension pg_trgm;" dhis ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring LDAP Authentication Properties in DHIS2 DESCRIPTION: Essential LDAP configuration settings in dhis.conf file including server URL, manager credentials, and search parameters. This configuration enables DHIS2 to authenticate users against an LDAP server using SSL encryption for secure authentication. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/reference/ldap.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: properties CODE: ``` # LDAP server URL ldap.url = ldaps://domain.org:636 # LDAP manager entry distinguished name ldap.manager.dn = cn=johndoe,dc=domain,dc=org # LDAP manager entry password ldap.manager.password = xxxx # LDAP base search ldap.search.base = dc=domain,dc=org # LDAP search filter ldap.search.filter = (cn={0}) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Sending Data Values with POST Request DESCRIPTION: The basic POST endpoint for sending data value sets to DHIS2. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/data.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` POST /api/dataValueSets ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: SQL Query for DHIS2 Data Values Report DESCRIPTION: SQL query that creates a report displaying raw data values at the fourth level in the organization unit hierarchy. Uses parameters for dynamic filtering and joins multiple tables including organization units and data values. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/user/configure-report-functionality.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: SQL CODE: ``` select district.name as district, chiefdom.name as chiefdom, ou.name as facility, bcg.value as bcg, yellowfever.value as yellowfever, measles.value as measles from organisationunit ou left outer join _orgunitstructure ous on (ou.organisationunitid=ous.organisationunitid) left outer join organisationunit district on (ous.idlevel2=district.organisationunitid) left outer join organisationunit chiefdom on (ous.idlevel3=chiefdom.organisationunitid) left outer join ( select sourceid, sum(cast(value as double precision)) as value from datavalue where dataelementid=359706 and periodid=$P!{periods} group by sourceid) as bcg on bcg.sourceid=ou.organisationunitid left outer join ( select sourceid, sum(cast(value as double precision)) as value from datavalue where dataelementid=35 and periodid=$P!{periods} group by sourceid) as yellowfever on yellowfever.sourceid=ou.organisationunitid where ous.level=4 and ous.$P!{organisationunit_level_column}=$P!{organisationunits} order by district.name, chiefdom.name, ou.name; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Nginx SSL Configuration DESCRIPTION: Enhanced Nginx configuration with SSL support, including HTTP to HTTPS redirection and SSL certificate settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/reference/reverse_proxy_nginx.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` http { gzip on; # Enables compression, incl Web API content-types gzip_types "application/json;charset=utf-8" application/json "application/javascript;charset=utf-8" application/javascript text/javascript "application/xml;charset=utf-8" application/xml text/xml "text/css;charset=utf-8" text/css "text/plain;charset=utf-8" text/plain; # HTTP server - rewrite to force use of SSL server { listen 80; rewrite ^ https://$request_uri? permanent; } # HTTPS server server { listen 443 ssl; client_max_body_size 10M; ssl on; ssl_certificate server.crt; ssl_certificate_key server.key; ssl_session_cache shared:SSL:20m; ssl_session_timeout 10m; ssl_protocols TLSv1 TLSv1.1 TLSv1.2; ssl_ciphers RC4:HIGH:!aNULL:!MD5; ssl_prefer_server_ciphers on; # Proxy pass to servlet container location / { proxy_pass http://localhost:8080/; proxy_redirect off; proxy_set_header Host $host; proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr; proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for; proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto https; proxy_buffer_size 128k; proxy_buffers 8 128k; proxy_busy_buffers_size 256k; proxy_cookie_path ~*^/(.*) "/$1; SameSite=Lax"; } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: System Configuration Properties DESCRIPTION: Core system configuration settings including read-only mode, session timeout, and SQL view protections. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/reference/dhis.conf.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: properties CODE: ``` system.read_only_mode = on | off system.session.timeout = (seconds) system.sql_view_table_protection = on | off system.system.sql_view_write_enabled = on | off ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Update Metadata Proposal JSON Format in DHIS2 DESCRIPTION: Example JSON payload for proposing an update to an existing metadata object using JSON patch operations. Specifies the target object type, ID, and the changes to be applied to the object. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/metadata.md#2025-04-22_snippet_108 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "type": "UPDATE", "target": "ORGANISATION_UNIT", "targetId": "", "change": [ {"op": "replace", "path": "/name", "value": "New name"} ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Multiple Objects to Collection DESCRIPTION: JSON payload structure for adding multiple objects to a collection using identifiable objects array. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/metadata.md#2025-04-22_snippet_25 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "identifiableObjects": [{ "id": "IDA" }, { "id": "IDB" }, { "id": "IDC" } ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Applying Measure Criteria to Analytics API Query DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how to use measureCriteria to filter data records based on aggregated data values, returning only records within specified ranges. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/analytics.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: url CODE: ``` /api/analytics?dimension=dx:fbfJHSPpUQD;cYeuwXTCPkU&dimension=pe:2014&dimension=ou:O6uvpzGd5pu;lc3eMKXaEfw&measureCriteria=GE:6500;LT:33000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Generating Data Value Set Template in DHIS2 DESCRIPTION: This API endpoint is used to generate a data value set template for a specific data set in DHIS2. It supports both XML and JSON response formats. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/data.md#2025-04-22_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` /api/dataSets/BfMAe6Itzgt/dataValueSet ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: User Authorities Table in Markdown DESCRIPTION: A markdown table listing DHIS2 user authorities with their corresponding system codes. The table includes permissions for managing data, entities, and system configurations. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/user/user-authorities.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | | | |----------------------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------| | Accept data at lower levels | F_ACCEPT_DATA_LOWER_LEVELS | | Access my data mart | F_MYDATAMART_VIEW | | Add Facility | F_FRED_CREATE | | Add Locale | F_LOCALE_ADD | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Inpatient Morbidity Events in DHIS2 DESCRIPTION: Example query for retrieving events from the 'Inpatient morbidity and mortality' program, including specific date range, organization units, and data elements with filtering. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/analytics.md#2025-04-22_snippet_22 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` /api/analytics/events/query/eBAyeGv0exc?startDate=2016-01-01&endDate=2016-10-31 &dimension=ou:O6uvpzGd5pu;fdc6uOvgoji&dimension=oZg33kd9taw&dimension=qrur9Dvnyt5:EQ:18 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Sorting Events Query in DHIS2 DESCRIPTION: Example of applying sorting to an events query, demonstrating descending sort on event date and ascending sort on a data element dimension. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/analytics.md#2025-04-22_snippet_24 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` /api/analytics/events/query/eBAyeGv0exc?startDate=2016-01-01&endDate=2016-10-31 &dimension=ou:O6uvpzGd5pu&dimension=qrur9Dvnyt5&desc=EVENTDATE&asc=qrur9Dvnyt5 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Generating SSL Certificate Signing Request for NGINX and DHIS2 DESCRIPTION: Command to generate a CSR (Certificate Signing Request) and private key for SSL implementation with NGINX. This creates a 2048-bit RSA key and a CSR file that can be sent to a certificate authority. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/installation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_43 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` openssl req -new -newkey rsa:2048 -nodes -keyout server.key -out server.csr ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Events by Program and Organization Unit in DHIS2 API DESCRIPTION: Example request to fetch events for a specific program and organization unit using the DHIS2 tracker API. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/tracker.md#2025-04-22_snippet_36 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` GET /api/tracker/events?orgUnit=DiszpKrYNg8&program=eBAyeGv0exc ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Event Data Values in DHIS2 Tracker API DESCRIPTION: Updates data values for a specific event by making a POST request to /api/tracker endpoint with the event details and new data values. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/tracker.md#2025-04-22_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "events": [ { "event": "ZwwuwNp6gVd", "dataValues": [ { "dataElement": "bx6fsa0t90x", "value": "true" } ], "attributeOptionCombo": "HllvX50cXC0", "attributeCategoryOptions": "xYerKDKCefk", "enrollment": "MNWZ6hnuhSw", "enrollmentStatus": "ACTIVE", "occurredAt": "2019-08-01T00:00:00.000", "orgUnit": "y77LiPqLMoq", "program": "IpHINAT79UW", "programStage": "A03MvHHogjR", "scheduledAt": "2019-08-19T13:59:13.688", "status": "ACTIVE", "trackedEntity": "Kj6vYde4LHh" } ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Fixed Delay Job Configuration in DHIS2 DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the JSON structure for creating a job configuration with a fixed delay scheduling type in DHIS2. It includes the delay in seconds and a job parameter for the full update hour. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/scheduling.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "name": "Continuous analytics table", "jobType": "CONTINUOUS_ANALYTICS_TABLE", "delay": "120", "jobParameters": { "fullUpdateHourOfDay": 4 } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Pre-Aggregation Measure Criteria in Analytics API DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the use of preAggregationMeasureCriteria to filter data before aggregation is performed, aggregating only data within specified criteria. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/analytics.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: url CODE: ``` /api/analytics?dimension=dx:fbfJHSPpUQD;cYeuwXTCPkU&dimension=pe:2014&dimension=ou:O6uvpzGd5pu;lc3eMKXaEfw&preAggregationMeasureCriteria=GE:10;LT:100 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic DHIS2 Server Configuration Properties DESCRIPTION: Configuration settings for maximum concurrent user sessions and remote server access control for the route API endpoint. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/reference/dhis.conf.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: properties CODE: ``` max.sessions.per_user = 10 route.remote_servers_allowed = https://* ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Redis for DHIS2 Cache Invalidation DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the necessary properties to enable Redis-based cache invalidation in DHIS2. It includes settings for Redis connection and SSL usage. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/installation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_30 LANGUAGE: properties CODE: ``` # Cache invalidation config redis.cache.invalidation.enabled = on # Shared Redis configuration redis.host = REDIS_HOST redis.port = REDIS_PORT redis.password = PASSWORD (Optional, only if enabled on Redis server) redis.use.ssl = true (Optional, only if enabled on Redis server) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Redis Cluster Settings in DHIS2 DESCRIPTION: Complete Redis configuration in dhis.conf including cluster leader election settings. Specifies core connection properties and optional leader time-to-live duration. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/how-to/tomcat-clustering.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: properties CODE: ``` # Redis Configuration redis.enabled = on # Shared Redis configuration redis.host = REDIS_HOST redis.port = REDIS_PORT redis.password = PASSWORD (Optional, only if enabled on Redis server) redis.use.ssl = true (Optional, only if enabled on Redis server) # Optional, defaults to 2 minutes leader.time.to.live.minutes=4 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Specifying Custom Date Range in Analytics API Query DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use startDate and endDate parameters to define a custom date range for data aggregation, which cannot be used with period dimensions or filters. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/analytics.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: url CODE: ``` /api/analytics.json?dimension=dx:fbfJHSPpUQD;cYeuwXTCPkU&dimension=ou:ImspTQPwCqd&startDate=2018-01-01&endDate=2018-06-01 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Calculating Gestational Age in Weeks Using Program Rule Functions DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to calculate the gestational age in weeks using nested d2 functions. It uses d2:daysBetween to calculate the number of days between the last menstrual date and the current event date, then divides by 7 and rounds down using d2:floor. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/user/configure-programs-in-the-maintenance-app.md#2025-04-22_snippet_34 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` d2:floor( d2:daysBetween(#{lastMenstrualDate},V{event_date}) / 7 ) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Aggregate Data Exchange Definition in DHIS2 (JSON) DESCRIPTION: This JSON payload defines an aggregate data exchange between two DHIS2 instances. It specifies the source data (program indicators) and target data (data elements) using the 'code' identifier scheme. The exchange aggregates data from facility level to national level and from event data to monthly data values. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/data-exchange.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "name": "Immunization doses program indicators to data elements", "source": { "requests": [ { "name": "Immunization doses", "dx": [ "BCG_DOSE", "MEASLES_DOSE", "YELLOW_FEVER_DOSE" ], "pe": [ "202201" ], "ou": [ "OU_525" ], "inputIdScheme": "code", "outputIdScheme": "code" } ] }, "target": { "type": "EXTERNAL", "api": { "url": "https://play.dhis2.org/2.38.2.1", "username": "admin", "password": "district" }, "request": { "idScheme": "code" } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring DHIS2 Monitoring Properties DESCRIPTION: Configuration properties for enabling different monitoring aspects in DHIS2. These properties are set in the dhis.conf file to enable monitoring for API, JVM, database pool, Hibernate, uptime, and CPU metrics. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/installation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_34 LANGUAGE: properties CODE: ``` monitoring.api.enabled = on monitoring.jvm.enabled = on monitoring.dbpool.enabled = on monitoring.hibernate.enabled = off monitoring.uptime.enabled = on monitoring.cpu.enabled = on ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Tracked Entities with Filters in DHIS2 API DESCRIPTION: Examples of GET requests to the DHIS2 Tracker API for querying tracked entities with various filters and parameters. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/tracker.md#2025-04-22_snippet_26 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` GET /api/tracker/trackedEntities?program=IpHINAT79UW&orgUnits=DiszpKrYNg8 ``` LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` GET /api/tracker/trackedEntities?program=IpHINAT79UW&orgUnits=DiszpKrYNg8&filter=w75KJ2mc4zz:EQ:John ``` LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` GET /api/tracker/trackedEntities?orgUnits=DiszpKrYNg8&program=ur1Edk5Oe2n&filter=lw1SqmMlnfh:GT:150&filter=lw1SqmMlnfh:LT:190 ``` LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` GET /api/tracker/trackedEntities?orgUnits=DiszpKrYNg8&program=ur1Edk5Oe2n&filter=lw1SqmMlnfh:EQ:/:/,// ``` LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` GET /api/tracker/trackedEntities?orgUnits=DiszpKrYNg8&program=IpHINAT79UW&fields=trackedEntity,enrollments[enrolledAt]&enrollmentEnrolledAfter=2024-01-01 ``` LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` GET /api/tracker/trackedEntities?trackedEntityType=nEenWmSyUEp&orgUnits=DiszpKrYNg8&filter=w75KJ2mc4zz:IN:Scott;Jimmy;Santiago ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring JWT Authentication for DHIS2 API Clients DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to enable JWT authentication for API-based clients in DHIS2. It includes settings for OIDC login, client credentials, and JWT token support. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/installation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_25 LANGUAGE: properties CODE: ``` # Enables OIDC login oidc.oauth2.login.enabled = on # Minimum required config variables: oidc.provider.google.client_id = my_client_id oidc.provider.google.client_secret = my_client_secret # Enable JWT support oauth2.authorization.server.enabled = off oidc.jwt.token.authentication.enabled = on # Define client 1 using JWT tokens oidc.provider.google.ext_client.0.client_id = JWT_CLIENT_ID # Define client 2 using JWT tokens oidc.provider.google.ext_client.1.client_id = JWT_CLIENT_ID ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating PostgreSQL User and Database for DHIS2 DESCRIPTION: Commands to create a PostgreSQL user 'dhis' and a database 'dhis2' for DHIS2. This sets up the necessary database environment for DHIS2. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/installation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo -u postgres createuser -SDRP dhis sudo -u postgres createdb -O dhis dhis2 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Validation Results in DHIS2 API DESCRIPTION: Makes a GET request to retrieve validation results that have been persisted during validation analysis. These results can be used for analytics and notifications. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/data-validation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` GET /api/33/validationResults ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic PostgreSQL Administration Commands in SQL DESCRIPTION: SQL commands for basic PostgreSQL administration tasks such as creating a database, creating a user, and granting login permissions. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/how-to/PostgreSQL-setup.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: sql CODE: ``` CREATE DATABASE dhis; ``` LANGUAGE: sql CODE: ``` CREATE ROLE "dhis" WITH ENCRYPTED PASSWORD 'secure_password'; ``` LANGUAGE: sql CODE: ``` ALTER ROLE "dhis" WITH LOGIN; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Flat Payload Structure for DHIS2 Tracker Import DESCRIPTION: Example of a flat payload structure for DHIS2 Tracker Import. It includes collections for tracked entities, enrollments, events, and relationships. This format is suitable for existing data with assigned UIDs. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/tracker.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "trackedEntities": [ { "orgUnit": "y77LiPqLMoq", "trackedEntity": "Kj6vYde4LHh", "trackedEntityType": "nEenWmSyUEp" }, { "orgUnit": "y77LiPqLMoq", "trackedEntity": "Gjaiu3ea38E", "trackedEntityType": "nEenWmSyUEp" } ], "enrollments": [ { "enrolledAt": "2019-08-19T00:00:00.000", "enrollment": "MNWZ6hnuhSw", "occurredAt": "2019-08-19T00:00:00.000", "orgUnit": "y77LiPqLMoq", "program": "IpHINAT79UW", "status": "ACTIVE", "trackedEntity": "Kj6vYde4LHh", "trackedEntityType": "nEenWmSyUEp" } ], "events": [ { "attributeCategoryOptions": "xYerKDKCefk", "attributeOptionCombo": "HllvX50cXC0", "dataValues": [ { "dataElement": "bx6fsa0t90x", "value": "true" }, { "dataElement": "UXz7xuGCEhU", "value": "5.7" } ], "enrollment": "MNWZ6hnuhSw", "enrollmentStatus": "ACTIVE", "event": "ZwwuwNp6gVd", "occurredAt": "2019-08-01T00:00:00.000", "orgUnit": "y77LiPqLMoq", "program": "IpHINAT79UW", "programStage": "A03MvHHogjR", "scheduledAt": "2019-08-19T13:59:13.688", "status": "ACTIVE", "trackedEntity": "Kj6vYde4LHh" }, { "attributeCategoryOptions": "xYerKDKCefk", "attributeOptionCombo": "HllvX50cXC0", "enrollment": "MNWZ6hnuhSw", "enrollmentStatus": "ACTIVE", "event": "XwwuwNp6gVE", "occurredAt": "2019-08-01T00:00:00.000", "orgUnit": "y77LiPqLMoq", "program": "IpHINAT79UW", "programStage": "ZzYYXq4fJie", "scheduledAt": "2019-08-19T13:59:13.688", "status": "ACTIVE", "trackedEntity": "Kj6vYde4LHh" } ], "relationships": [ { "from": { "trackedEntity": { "trackedEntity": "Kj6vYde4LHh" } }, "relationshipType": "dDrh5UyCyvQ", "to": { "trackedEntity": { "trackedEntity": "Gjaiu3ea38E" } } } ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: DHIS2 System Settings Table in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Markdown table documenting general system settings including analytics limits, infrastructure configurations, and system notifications. Each setting is described with its purpose and implications. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/user/system-settings.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Setting | Description | |---|--| | **Maximum number of analytics records** | Increase this number to provide more records from the analytics.

The default value is 50,000.

**Warning**

Use the setting **Unlimited** carefully, it might result in a very high load on your server. | | **Maximum number of SQL view records** | Set the maximum number of records in a SQL view.

The default value is Unlimited. | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Analytics Data with Data Element Operands in DHIS2 API DESCRIPTION: This API call demonstrates how to use data element operands in the 'dx' dimension, including the use of wildcards for category option combinations. It also specifies a time period and an organization unit filter. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/analytics.md#2025-04-22_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` /api/analytics.json?dimension=dx:Uvn6LCg7dVU.*.j8vBiBqGf6O;Uvn6LCg7dVU.Z4oQs46iTeR&dimension=pe:LAST_12_MONTHS&filter=ou:ImspTQPwCqd ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example Data Value Set in JSON for Mortality Data DESCRIPTION: A practical example of a data value set in JSON format for the 'Mortality < 5 years' data set. Contains actual identifiers and values for three disease cases in Ngelehun CHC. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/data.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "dataSet": "pBOMPrpg1QX", "completeDate": "2014-02-03", "period": "201401", "orgUnit": "DiszpKrYNg8", "dataValues": [ { "dataElement": "f7n9E0hX8qk", "value": "1" }, { "dataElement": "Ix2HsbDMLea", "value": "2" }, { "dataElement": "eY5ehpbEsB7", "value": "3" } ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Linked Accounts for DHIS2 OIDC Authentication DESCRIPTION: This configuration allows mapping a single identity provider account to multiple DHIS2 accounts. It enables users to switch between linked accounts via API calls. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/installation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_26 LANGUAGE: properties CODE: ``` # Enable a single OIDC account to log in as one of several DHIS2 accounts linked_accounts.enabled = on ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring AWS S3 Storage in DHIS2 DESCRIPTION: Configuration properties for setting up AWS S3 as the file storage provider in DHIS2. Includes settings for provider type, container location, datacenter location, and authentication credentials. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/reference/file-storage.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: properties CODE: ``` # File store provider. Currently 'filesystem' (default), 'aws-s3' and 's3' are supported. filestore.provider = 'aws-s3' # Directory in external directory on local file system or bucket in AWS S3 or S3 API filestore.container = files # The following configuration is applicable to cloud storage only (provider 'aws-s3' or 's3') # Datacenter location. Optional but recommended for performance reasons. filestore.location = eu-west-1 # Username / Access key for AWS S3 or S3 APIs filestore.identity = xxxx # Password / Secret key for AWS S3 or S3 APIs (sensitive) filestore.secret = xxxx ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Nested Payload Structure for DHIS2 Tracker Import DESCRIPTION: Example of a nested payload structure for DHIS2 Tracker Import. Tracker objects are embedded within their parent objects. This format is commonly used and doesn't require providing UIDs for references between objects. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/tracker.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "trackedEntities": [ { "enrollments": [ { "attributes": [ { "attribute": "zDhUuAYrxNC", "displayName": "Last name", "value": "Kelly" }, { "attribute": "w75KJ2mc4zz", "displayName": "First name", "value": "John" } ], "enrolledAt": "2019-08-19T00:00:00.000", "events": [ { "attributeCategoryOptions": "xYerKDKCefk", "attributeOptionCombo": "HllvX50cXC0", "dataValues": [ { "dataElement": "bx6fsa0t90x", "value": "true" }, { "dataElement": "UXz7xuGCEhU", "value": "5.7" } ], "enrollmentStatus": "ACTIVE", "notes": [ { "value": "need to follow up" } ], "occurredAt": "2019-08-01T00:00:00.000", "orgUnit": "y77LiPqLMoq", "program": "IpHINAT79UW", "programStage": "A03MvHHogjR", "scheduledAt": "2019-08-19T13:59:13.688", "status": "ACTIVE" } ], "occurredAt": "2019-08-19T00:00:00.000", "orgUnit": "y77LiPqLMoq", "program": "IpHINAT79UW", "status": "ACTIVE", "trackedEntityType": "nEenWmSyUEp" } ], "orgUnit": "y77LiPqLMoq", "trackedEntityType": "nEenWmSyUEp" } ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Multiple User Invitations cURL Command in DHIS2 Web API DESCRIPTION: cURL command example for sending multiple user invitations by POSTing the JSON payload to the invites endpoint. Specifies the content type as JSON and includes basic authentication. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/users.md#2025-04-22_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -d @invites.json "localhost/api/33/users/invites" -u admin:district -H "Content-Type:application/json" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Analytics Query Format DESCRIPTION: Generic format for querying analytics data with dimensions and items. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/analytics.md#2025-04-22_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` /api/analytics?dimension=dim-id:dim-item;dim-item&dimension=dim-id:dim-item;dim-item ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Sending Bulk Data Values in CSV Format DESCRIPTION: Example of sending data values using CSV format. Shows the required column headers and data structure for CSV imports. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/data.md#2025-04-22_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: csv CODE: ``` "dataelement","period","orgunit","categoryoptioncombo","attributeoptioncombo","value" "f7n9E0hX8qk","201401","DiszpKrYNg8","bRowv6yZOF2","bRowv6yZOF2","1" "Ix2HsbDMLea","201401","DiszpKrYNg8","bRowv6yZOF2","bRowv6yZOF2","2" "eY5ehpbEsB7","201401","DiszpKrYNg8","bRowv6yZOF2","bRowv6yZOF2","3" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Data Store Entry - BASH/JSON DESCRIPTION: Example of updating an existing key in the DHIS2 data store using curl with JSON array payload. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/data-store.md#2025-04-22_snippet_18 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl "https://play.dhis2.org/demo/api/33/dataStore/foo/key_1" -X PUT -d "[1, 2, 3]" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -u admin:district ``` LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "httpStatus": "OK", "httpStatusCode": 200, "status": "OK", "message": "Key 'key_1' updated." } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Assigning User to Event in DHIS2 Tracker API - JSON Example DESCRIPTION: Example of how to assign a user to an event by providing the user UID in the assignedUser field of the event object. This requires user assignment to be enabled on the program stage and the user UID must reference a valid existing user. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/tracker.md#2025-04-22_snippet_23 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { ... "events": [ { "event": "ZwwuwNp6gVd", "programStage": "nlXNK4b7LVr", "orgUnit": "O6uvpzGd5pu", "enrollment": "MNWZ6hnuhSw", "assignedUser" : "M0fCOxtkURr" } ], ... } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Up Data Encryption for DHIS2 DESCRIPTION: This configuration enables data encryption in DHIS2 by setting an encryption password. The password must be at least 24 characters long and should be kept secret. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/installation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_28 LANGUAGE: properties CODE: ``` encryption.password = xxxx ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Payload Structure for Multiple Object Types Sharing in DHIS2 API (JSON) DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates the payload structure for sharing multiple object types using the 'api/metadata/sharing' endpoint. It includes examples of modifying sharing settings for data elements, datasets, and programs. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/sharing.md#2025-04-22_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "dataElements": { "fbfJHSPpUQD": [ { "op": "replace", "path": "/sharing/users", "value": { "NOOF56dveaZ": { "access": "rw------", "id": "CotVI2NX0rI" }, "Kh68cDMwZsg": { "access": "rw------", "id": "DLjZWMsVsq2" } } } ] }, "dataSets": { "cYeuwXTCPkA": [ { "op": "remove", "path": "/sharing/users/N3PZBUlN8vq" } ], "cYeuwXTCPkU": [ { "op": "add", "path": "/sharing/users/DXyJmlo9rge", "value": { "access": "rw------", "id": "DXyJmlo9rge" } } ] }, "programs": { "GOLswS44mh8": [ { "op": "add", "path": "/sharing/userGroups", "value": { "NOOF56dveaZ": { "access": "rw------", "id": "NOOF56dveaZ" }, "Kh68cDMwZsg": { "access": "rw------", "id": "Kh68cDMwZsg" } } } ] } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deleting Tracked Entities in DHIS2 Tracker API DESCRIPTION: Deletes tracked entities and their associated enrollments, events and relationships via POST request to /api/tracker endpoint. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/tracker.md#2025-04-22_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "trackedEntities": [ { "trackedEntity": "Kj6vYde4LHh" }, { "trackedEntity": "Gjaiu3ea38E" } ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deleting DHIS2 App via cURL DESCRIPTION: Removes an installed DHIS2 app using its app-key identifier. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/apps.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -X DELETE -u user:pass "http://server.com/api/33/apps/" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Event Clustering Analytics in DHIS2 DESCRIPTION: Example of querying the /analytics/events/cluster endpoint for retrieving clustered geospatial event data. This query specifies program, date range, organisation unit level, cluster size, and bounding box. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/analytics.md#2025-04-22_snippet_32 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` /api/analytics/events/cluster/eBAyeGv0exc?startDate=2016-01-01&endDate=2016-10-31 &dimension=ou:LEVEL-2&clusterSize=100000 &bbox=-13.2682125,7.3721619,-10.4261178,9.904012&includeClusterPoints=false ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing PostgreSQL and PostGIS DESCRIPTION: Command to install PostgreSQL 12 and PostGIS 3 on Ubuntu. These are required for DHIS2 database operations and GIS features. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/installation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo apt-get install -y postgresql-12 postgresql-12-postgis-3 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Registering for DHIS2 Data Entry Events with JavaScript DESCRIPTION: Example of how to register callback functions for DHIS2 data entry events using dhis2.util.on(). The example shows how to capture form ready events, data value saved events, and completion events. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/user/configure-metadata.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Filtering Data Elements in DHIS2 Events Query DESCRIPTION: Examples of applying filters to data elements in an events query, demonstrating range filtering and multiple value filtering. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/analytics.md#2025-04-22_snippet_26 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` &dimension=UXz7xuGCEhU:GT:2000&dimension=UXz7xuGCEhU:LT:4000 ``` LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` &dimension=qrur9Dvnyt5:IN:18;19;20 ``` LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` &dimension=qrur9Dvnyt5:GT:5:LT:15 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example JSON Metadata for Import DESCRIPTION: Example of JSON metadata payload for importing data elements and indicators into DHIS2. The payload includes two data elements and one indicator with their properties. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/metadata.md#2025-04-22_snippet_38 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "dataElements": [ { "name": "EPI - IPV 3 doses given", "shortName": "EPI - IPV 3 doses given", "aggregationType": "SUM", "domainType": "AGGREGATE", "valueType": "INTEGER_ZERO_OR_POSITIVE" }, { "name": "EPI - IPV 4 doses given", "shortName": "EPI - IPV 4 doses given", "aggregationType": "SUM", "domainType": "AGGREGATE", "valueType": "INTEGER_ZERO_OR_POSITIVE" } ], "indicators": [ { "name": "EPI - ADS stock used", "shortName": "ADS stock used", "numerator": "#{LTb8XeeqeqI}+#{Fs28ZQJET6V}-#{A3mHIZd2tPg}", "numeratorDescription": "ADS 0.05 ml used", "denominator": "1", "denominatorDescription": "1", "annualized": false, "indicatorType": { "id": "kHy61PbChXr" } } ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: DHIS2 Data Exchange Import Summary Response (JSON) DESCRIPTION: This JSON response shows the import summary after executing a data exchange in DHIS2. It indicates the number of data values successfully imported, updated, deleted, or ignored during the exchange process. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/data-exchange.md#2025-04-22_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "responseType": "ImportSummaries", "status": "SUCCESS", "imported": 3, "updated": 0, "deleted": 0, "ignored": 0 } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring SQL View Table Protection DESCRIPTION: Property to enable or disable sensitive database table protection for SQL views in DHIS2. When enabled, it prohibits SQL views from querying database tables with sensitive data. Default is 'on'. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/installation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_37 LANGUAGE: properties CODE: ``` system.sql_view_table_protection = on | off ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating an Internal Aggregate Data Exchange in DHIS2 DESCRIPTION: This JSON payload demonstrates how to create an internal aggregate data exchange, where event data is computed with program indicators and saved as aggregate data values. It includes source parameters, requests with dimensions, periods, and filters. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/data-exchange.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "name": "Internal data exchange", "source": { "params": { "periodTypes": [ "MONTHLY", "QUARTERLY" ] }, "requests": [ { "name": "ANC", "visualization": null, "dx": [ "fbfJHSPpUQD", "cYeuwXTCPkU", "Jtf34kNZhzP" ], "pe": [ "LAST_12_MONTHS", "202201" ], "ou": [ "ImspTQPwCqd" ], "filters": [ { "dimension": "Bpx0589u8y0", "items": [ "oRVt7g429ZO", "MAs88nJc9nL" ] } ], "inputIdScheme": "UID", "outputDataElementIdScheme": "UID", "outputOrgUnitIdScheme": "UID", "outputIdScheme": "UID" } ] }, "target": { "type": "INTERNAL", "request": { "dataElementIdScheme": "UID", "orgUnitIdScheme": "UID", "categoryOptionComboIdScheme": "UID", "idScheme": "UID" } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Aggregate Data Value Audits with DHIS2 API DESCRIPTION: Endpoint for retrieving audit records of aggregate data values. This endpoint allows filtering by various parameters including data set, data element, period, organisation unit, and audit type. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/audit.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` /api/audits/dataValue ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring PostgreSQL Settings for DHIS2 DESCRIPTION: A set of PostgreSQL configuration settings optimized for DHIS2 performance. These settings cover various aspects such as memory allocation, query planning, and write operations. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/concepts/PostgreSQL-performance-tuning.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` jit = off max_connections = 200 shared_buffers = 3GB work_mem = 24MB maintenance_work_mem = 1GB temp_buffers = 16MB effective_cache_size = 8GB checkpoint_completion_target = 0.8 synchronous_commit = off wal_writer_delay = 10s random_page_cost = 1.1 max_locks_per_transaction = 96 track_activity_query_size = 8192 jit = off ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Analytics Data with Group Syntax in DHIS2 API DESCRIPTION: This API call shows how to use group syntax in the 'dx' dimension to include data element groups, indicator groups, and reporting rates. It also specifies a time period and an organization unit filter. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/analytics.md#2025-04-22_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` /api/analytics.json?dimension=dx:DE_GROUP-qfxEYY9xAl6;IN_GROUP-oehv9EO3vP7;BfMAe6Itzgt.REPORTING_RATE&dimension=pe:LAST_12_MONTHS&filter=ou:ImspTQPwCqd ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deleting Validation Results by Organization Unit and Period in DHIS2 API DESCRIPTION: Makes a DELETE request to remove validation results for a specific organization unit during Q1 of 2020. Combines filters with AND logic. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/data-validation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` DELETE /api/36/validationResults?ou=NqwvaQC1ni4&pe=2020Q1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Transferring Tracker Ownership in DHIS2 API DESCRIPTION: PUT request to transfer ownership of a TrackedEntity-Program from one organization unit to another. This is useful for patient referrals or migrations. Only users with ownership access can perform transfers. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/tracker.md#2025-04-22_snippet_49 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` /api/tracker/ownership/transfer?trackedEntity=DiszpKrYNg8&program=eBAyeGv0exc&ou=EJNxP3WreNP ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring BulkSMS Gateway in DHIS2 DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for the BulkSMS gateway. Includes the gateway type, name, username, and password for authentication. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/sms.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "type": "bulksms", "name": "bulkSMS", "username": "bulkuser", "password": "abc123" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Filtering Data Elements by Multiple IDs using 'in' Operator in DHIS2 API DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how to use the 'in' operator to filter data elements matching multiple ID values. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/metadata.md#2025-04-22_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` /api/dataElements.json?filter=id:in:[fbfJHSPpUQD,cYeuwXTCPkU] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Tracker Import Job Status Response Example in JSON DESCRIPTION: Example JSON response showing the status and progress of a tracker import job. ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying DHIS2 Tracker Import Summary Structure in JSON DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the overall structure of an import summary, including status, validation report, stats, and bundle report. It demonstrates how different tracker objects (EVENT, ENROLLMENT, RELATIONSHIP, TRACKED_ENTITY) are represented in the summary. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/tracker.md#2025-04-22_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "status": "OK", "validationReport": { "errorReports": [], "warningReports": [] }, "stats": { "created": 3, "updated": 0, "deleted": 0, "ignored": 0, "total": 3 }, "bundleReport": { "typeReportMap": { "EVENT": { "trackerType": "EVENT", "stats": { "created": 1, "updated": 0, "deleted": 0, "ignored": 0, "total": 1 }, "objectReports": [ { "trackerType": "EVENT", "uid": "gTZBPT3Jq39", "errorReports": [] } ] }, "ENROLLMENT": { "trackerType": "ENROLLMENT", "stats": { "created": 1, "updated": 0, "deleted": 0, "ignored": 0, "total": 1 }, "objectReports": [ { "trackerType": "ENROLLMENT", "uid": "ffcvJvWjiNZ", "errorReports": [] } ] }, "RELATIONSHIP": { "trackerType": "RELATIONSHIP", "stats": { "created": 0, "updated": 0, "deleted": 0, "ignored": 0, "total": 0 }, "objectReports": [] }, "TRACKED_ENTITY": { "trackerType": "TRACKED_ENTITY", "stats": { "created": 1, "updated": 0, "deleted": 0, "ignored": 0, "total": 1 }, "objectReports": [ { "trackerType": "TRACKED_ENTITY", "uid": "aVcGf9iO8Xp", "errorReports": [] } ] } } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Custom Forms Using cURL in DHIS2 DESCRIPTION: Example of using cURL to create or update a custom data entry form by sending HTML content to the DHIS2 API. The request uses PUT method with text/html content type. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/metadata.md#2025-04-22_snippet_81 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -d @form.html "localhost/api/dataSets/BfMAe6Itzgt/form" -H "Content-Type:text/html" -u admin:district -X PUT ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding or Updating Min-Max Data Element in DHIS2 API DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet shows the request format for adding or updating a min-max data element in DHIS2. It includes minimum and maximum values, data element ID, source organization unit ID, and option combo ID. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/maintenance.md#2025-04-22_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "min": 1, "generated": false, "max": 100, "dataElement": { "id": "UOlfIjgN8X6" }, "source": { "id": "DiszpKrYNg8" }, "optionCombo": { "id": "psbwp3CQEhs" } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Feedback Recipients Using Curl DESCRIPTION: Example of setting the feedback recipients user group using curl SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/settings-and-configuration.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl "localhost/api/33/configuration/feedbackRecipients" -d "wl5cDMuUhmF" -H "Content-Type:text/plain"-u admin:district ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Response Caching in NGINX for DHIS2 DESCRIPTION: NGINX configuration to implement caching for DHIS2 responses, improving performance and reducing server load. This setup allocates 250MB for caching and stores cached content in /var/cache/nginx with a one-day expiration time. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/installation.md#2025-04-22_snippet_46 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` http { .. proxy_cache_path /var/cache/nginx levels=1:2 keys_zone=dhis:250m inactive=1d; server { .. # Proxy pass to servlet container and potentially cache response location / { proxy_pass http://localhost:8080/; proxy_redirect off; proxy_set_header Host $host; proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr; proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for; proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto https; proxy_buffer_size 128k; proxy_buffers 8 128k; proxy_busy_buffers_size 256k; proxy_cookie_path ~*^/(.*) "/$1; SameSite=Lax"; proxy_cache dhis; } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Specific Tracked Entities with Program and Name Filter in DHIS2 DESCRIPTION: Example query to retrieve tracked entities of type 'Person' from specific programs where the first name equals 'James'. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/developer/web-api/analytics.md#2025-04-22_snippet_45 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` /api/41/analytics/trackedEntities/query/nEenWmSyUEp?program=IpHINAT79UW,WSGAb5XwJ3Y&dimension=IpHINAT79UW.w75KJ2mc4zz:eq:James ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating PostgreSQL User for DHIS2 DESCRIPTION: Command to create a non-privileged database user 'dhis' for DHIS2 to connect to the database. This user will own the DHIS2 database. SOURCE: https://github.com/dhis2/dhis2-docs/blob/master/src/sysadmin/getting-started/linux-manual-install.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` sudo -u postgres createuser -SDRP dhis ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing Data Elements with CSV in DHIS2 DESCRIPTION: Example CSV format for importing data elements into DHIS2. The file contains two data elements with their names, codes, and descriptions. The first row is always ignored during import.
